channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Problem with fly tipping and behind the tree and bushes there is loads of rubbish dumped, 25th July
item.description:
Today I’ve noticed a dead rat in front of my garden and I have children This rubbish needs to be cleared behind tree asap and needs to be addressed as these issues are becoming ridiculous there needs to be cameras put up to avoid people doing this as I don’t want to allow my children into garden when it’s getting done up to find dead rats constantly

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Keedonwood Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirt left behind, 25th July
item.description:
They were trimming wild greens from the pavement and the street today and they left everything behind. Our doors are on the street and I find it unacceptable for workers of the council (or even contractors) to leave our doorsteps at such a state especially after they were supposed to clean not create more dirt. My front door is always clean and I make a significant effort to keep it like that and I was SO disappointed to see that today. Full of soil! Please take action to clean that ASAP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-28, Chambers Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are repeater signs on the A127 as you approach the slip onto the M25, 25th July
item.description:
On the A127 travelling East towards the M25 there are no countdown repeater signs. I have reported it to Hvering and they have referred me to TFL but when you are their website it says that they do not maintain the A127. Who is right?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tents and rubbish, 25th July
item.description:
Homeless are dumping their tents and rubbish in Burgess park next to the tennis court. This is becoming a no go area for normal park visitors and is unacceptable. The council has a responsibility to remove all this rubbish so that anti social behaviour can not escalate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Addington Square, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
